## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 291]]<|/det|>
9702/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 390, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 559]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 213, 602]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 60.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 82, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>Data</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 112, 618, 131]]<|/det|>
acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81 \text{ m s}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 145, 663, 165]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00 \times 10^{8} \text{ m s}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 177, 648, 196]]<|/det|>
elementary charge \(e = 1.60 \times 10^{-19} \text{ C}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 208, 653, 227]]<|/det|>
unified atomic mass unit \(1 \text{ u} = 1.66 \times 10^{-27} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 240, 653, 259]]<|/det|>
rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67 \times 10^{-27} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 271, 653, 291]]<|/det|>
rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11 \times 10^{-31} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 303, 673, 322]]<|/det|>
Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02 \times 10^{23} \text{ mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 334, 673, 353]]<|/det|>
molar gas constant \(R = 8.31 \text{ J K}^{-1} \text{ mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 365, 673, 384]]<|/det|>
Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38 \times 10^{-23} \text{ J K}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 396, 710, 415]]<|/det|>
gravitational constant \(G = 6.67 \times 10^{-11} \text{ N m}^2 \text{ kg}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 427, 680, 446]]<|/det|>
permittivity of free space \(\varepsilon_0 = 8.85 \times 10^{-12} \text{ F m}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 446, 675, 476]]<|/det|>
\[(\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{-1})\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 488, 658, 507]]<|/det|>
Planck constant \(h = 6.63 \times 10^{-34} \text{ J s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 520, 710, 539]]<|/det|>
Stefan–Boltzmann constant \(\sigma = 5.67 \times 10^{-8} \text{ W m}^{-2} \text{ K}^{-4}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 577, 193, 594]]<|/det|>
<form>Formulae</form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 610, 603, 628]]<|/det|>
uniformly accelerated motion \(s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^2\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 626, 603, 647]]<|/det|>
\[v^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 661, 568, 680]]<|/det|>
hydrostatic pressure \(\Delta p = \rho g \Delta h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 692, 568, 711]]<|/det|>
upthrust \(F = \rho g V\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 725, 568, 757]]<|/det|>
Doppler effect for sound waves \(f_0 = \frac{f_s V}{V \pm V_s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 771, 576, 790]]<|/det|>
electric current \(I = \text{Anvq}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 803, 633, 822]]<|/det|>
resistors in series \(R = R_1 + R_2 + \ldots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[102, 835, 638, 864]]<|/det|>
resistors in parallel \(\frac{1}{R} = \frac{1}{R_1} + \frac{1}{R_2} + \ldots\)

An electric motor has an input power of \(900\mathrm{W}.\) The motor takes 1.0 minute to lift a load of weight \(240\mathrm{N}\) at constant speed through a vertical height of \(150\mathrm{m}\). Resistive forces are negligible.

<label>(i)</label>

<mark>[1]

The coil of the motor is made from wire of total length \(23\mathrm{m}\). The wire has a cross-sectional area of \(2.6 \times 10^{- 8}\mathrm{m}^2\) and is made from metal of resistivity \(1.7 \times 10^{- 8}\Omega \mathrm{m}\).

<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Two coherent sources X and Y of microwaves of frequency \(2.5 \times 10^{10} \text{Hz}\) are a distance of \(0.18 \text{m}\) apart in a vacuum, as shown in Fig. 6.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 112, 843, 388]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 408, 591, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 6.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 408, 591, 428]]<|/det|>
(not to scale)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 440, 789, 460]]<|/det|>
There is a phase difference of \(90^{\circ}\) between the waves emitted at the two sources.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 471, 918, 505]]<|/det|>
A microwave detector moves along the line PQ, which is parallel to the line joining the two sources and \(2.3 \text{m}\) away from it.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 517, 761, 536]]<|/det|>
Point O is on the line PQ at a position that is equidistant from the two sources.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 532, 828, 551]]<|/det|>
Point A is the position on line PQ where the intensity of the microwaves is the greatest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 565, 144, 584]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 565, 180, 584]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 564, 707, 584]]<|/det|>
Explain why the position of greatest intensity is not at point O.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 718, 181, 737]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 718, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 6.1, draw a cross \((\times)\) to show the position of the point on line PQ where the intensity minimum that is the closest to point O occurs. Label this point B.

Fig. 7.1 shows two resistors connected in series with a cell of electromotive force (e.m.f.) \(1.50 \text{V}\) and internal resistance \(0.28 \Omega\).

One of the resistors has resistance \(1.0 \Omega\). The other resistor has resistance \(R\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 345, 675, 364]]<|/det|>
